properties.displayName: [Preview]: Kubernetes clusters should gate deployment of images according to vulnerability scans
properties.description: Do not allow vulnerable containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. Verify that your images on the pod do not exceed your threshold vulnerabilities before creating or updating a pod based on results from ASC. If AzureDefenderInClusterDefense is not installed in your cluster, the policy remains compliant.

metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation.
List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.
Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

metadata.description: List of images regex pattern that will be excluded. Empty array means all images should be evaluated. example: exclude all images from the repo azure-defender-in-cluster-defense-repo in the blockreg ACR- ["(blockreg.azurecr.io/azure-defender-in-cluster-defense-repo).*"]
Indicator if the policy should ignore not patchable findings. if this indicator set to True, only findings that are patchable are evaluated against the severity thresholds.
List of finding ids that the policy should exclude them in the aggregation.
The number of allowed high severity findings that were found in scan findings in specific image.
The number of allowed medium severity findings that were found in scan findings in specific image.
The number of allowed low severity findings that were found in scan findings in specific image.
